title.narrative: EDUCATION OP 3 - INCREASED EFFECTIVENESS SYSTEM GOVERNANCE AND LEADERSHIP

description.narrative: By 2023, stakeholders at all levels of the education sector are implementing actions to increase the effectiveness of the governance and leadership of this system through transparency, evidence-based and inclusive decisions and accountability, including during emergencies., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023 more boys and girls (5-18 years old) in Madagascar, specially the most excluded, will be exposed to effective learning experiences that will lead to the acquisition of the necessary competencies for an enriching life.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2023, stakeholders at all levels of the education sector are implementing actions to increase the effectiveness of thegovernance and leadership of this system through transparency, evidence-based and inclusive decisions and accountability, includingduring emergencies.

description.narrative: In 2021, two joint education sectoral reviews were conducted under the co-leadership of Malagasy Government and UNICEF. They were adapted in a hybrid online and face-to-face modality that ensured countrywide participation. UNICEF together with the French Cooperation and European Union organized the launch of the Education Common Basket Funds. This represents an important financial tool that is aligned with national financial procedures. Local actors (DREN and CISCO) were supported on respectively the development of the School Contract Plan (projet école contractualisée(PEC) and the training on analysis and interpretation of the household MICS data through the MICS-EAGLE Initiative. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021
